name: Sidhartha Sunkasari
about: Experienced Software Engineer with a Master’s degree in Computer Science and 2 years of experience at Amazon. Skilled in designing and maintaining large-scale distributed systems and end-to-end microservices. Passionate about leveraging cloud computing, AWS, Test Driven Development (TDD), CI/CD, and configuration-driven UI to deliver scalable and robust solutions. Actively seeking challenging software engineering opportunities where I can drive innovation and growth.

responsibilities: Implemented a system that aims at recovering $50M in bad debt by analyzing customer risk factors.
Implemented new data model that scaled item return capacity from 1,000 to 1 million in a single return contract.
Reduced API latency by 50% through plugin migration to support the new data model for improved performance and ensured backward compatibility.
Ensured system stability during peak traffic with optimized resource allocation by load testing and scaling the infrastructure.
Developed multi-tier return reason questionnaires for softline products in EU region.
Led operational excellence initiatives, driving process automation and implementing industry best practices to optimize team workflows.
Managed and maintained IAC websites, ensuring functionality, user-friendliness, and timely updates to support industrial assessment operations.
Provided IT support for troubleshooting, maintaining infrastructure to maintain compatibility of older software.
Taught CS101 (Introductory course in Data Analysis) to undergraduate students as part of Graduate Teaching Assistantship.

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science + MBA (Dual-Degree)

projects.name: Projecting Annotations for NER using BERT Transformer
projects.description: Utilized Named Entity Recognition (NER) to annotate the conllpp dataset by fine-tuning a BERT model. Designed a framework to extend this capability to low-resource languages.

projects.name: Online Appointment Booking System
projects.description: Developed an online appointment booking system supporting full CRUD operations in a NoSQL database, enabling users to schedule appointments across multiple time zones.

projects.name: Understanding the Drug Epidemic in West Virginia
projects.description: Created interactive dashboards to visualize the relationship between socio-economic factors and drug abuse–related overdoses at the county level.

additionalExperiencesAndAwards: Coordinated and created problem sets for the annual programming competition of JNTU "Code Poetry".
